Culinary & Agricultural Profile
1. Flavour and Form

Azolla has a mild, neutral, slightly grassy flavour and a soft, delicate texture. Its tiny, overlapping leaves form a dense, vibrant green mat on the water’s surface, creating a beautiful and functional living carpet.

2. The Ultimate Garden Partner

Its main role is as a sustainable nutrient source.

  • Living Fertilizer: Regularly harvest portions of the mat and add them directly to the growth media of other plants, such as those in the TuberTower or FruitForge, where it decomposes and releases a gentle, plant-available form of nitrogen.
  • Aquatic Filter: The dense mat helps purify water by absorbing excess nutrients, improving the environment for fish and shrimp in integrated systems.
  • Edible Use: While not a primary food source due to its small size, it can be blended into green smoothies for a nutrient boost.
3. The Harvest and Yield

The fern forms a continuous, self-renewing mat on the water’s surface. Harvesting is as simple as skimming a portion with a net. A single RFID Seed-Pad Cartridges mat provides a continuous yield of 30–50g of fresh biomass daily, perfect for feeding the rest of your balcony farm.
